intro: Lepigonum brevifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved bugloss, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its small, lance-shaped leaves are arranged oppositely along the stem. Lepigonum brevifolium is often found in open woodlands and mountainous regions, where it thrives in full sun.
